result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam M Fonseca was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Designer Drugs(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(hm)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
*Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
*Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
*If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Provide a DNA sample.
*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
*Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

*AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
*Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.

timeConds.notes: *3 MONTHS condition time with Huber.  Court approves transfer to Walworth County.  Court stayed commencement until 12/28/2015 by 5pm.  (Defendant to report to Milwaukee County if transfer is not approved.)

records.addlTxt: Bail Bond Refund Packet
Order DENYING Electronic Monitoring signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Atty Roth.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
Motion to Modify Conditions of Huber Release
Mailed Bail Refund Notice to Surety.

Defendant Adam M Fonseca in court with attorney Steven Richard Kohn.  Katherine Seelow for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS with 2 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.  Court approves transfer to Walworth County.

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 3 MONTHS condition time with Huber.  Court approves transfer to Walworth County.  Court stayed commencement until 12/28/2015 by 5pm.  (Defendant to report to Milwaukee County if transfer is not approved.)
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Adam M Fonseca in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam M Fonseca in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Student Intern Daniel Murphy under the supervision of Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam M Fonseca in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin for Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however parties request more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam M Fonseca in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing. State needs time to consider counter offer from defense and requests an adjournment.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 22.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam M Fonseca in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 7/23/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Adam M Fonseca in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Defense requests an adjourned Scheduling Conference. Case adjourned to branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam M Fonseca in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Ronald Dague for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
